bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Issue description</denchmark-h>
mlpack_fastmks -r optdigits.csv -v -k 10 -K hyptan returns with a segmentation fault. <denchmark-h:h4>Your environment</denchmark-h>
version of mlpack: git master and 3.0.4, maybe other version as well operating system: FreeBSD, Linux (debian) compiler: probably any gcc version or clang version version of dependencies (Boost/Armadillo): doesn't matter
<denchmark-h:h4>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run , you should see that it returns with a segmentation fault, <denchmark-link:mlpack.org/datasets/optdigits.tar.gz>optdigits</denchmark-link> dataset. The run will only fail if the kernel is used and if "-k" is set. <denchmark-h:h4>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
The executable should not fail with a segmentation fault. It should give a similar result as if run with: mlpack_fastmks -r optdigits.csv -v -k 10 -K gaussian. <denchmark-h:h4>Actual behavior</denchmark-h>
Here's some example output: [INFO ] Loading 'optdigits.csv' as CSV data. Size is 65 x 5620. [INFO ] Loaded reference data (65 x 5620). [INFO ] 5619 distance computations during tree construction. zsh: segmentation fault bin/mlpack_fastmks -r optdigits.csv -v -K hyptan --kernels_file kernels.csv -

I locate the crash to the candidatesPoints.top() in FastMKSRules<KernelType, TreeType>::CalculateBound(TreeType& queryNode) in fastmks_rules_imp.hpp to be empty. So candidates vector in FastMKSRules object contains empty CandidateList. Any comment on why?

I think you are right, and I can figure out why if I can reproduce the issue, but I can't reproduce it. Can you share the dataset you are using that causes the issue? (and also which version of mlpack you are using; you can get it with mlpack_fastmks --version)

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nttruong7>@nttruong7</denchmark-link> thanks for the info. I opened <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/1986>#1986</denchmark-link> with a fix for the issue. It's worth pointing out that I think we could make the command work on the optdigits dataset if the scale parameter (--scale) is chosen to be sufficiently small (maybe 0.001 or much smaller? I am not sure). Even so, it did highlight an issue that warrants fixing.
Since <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/1986>#1986</denchmark-link> is merged, I think we can close this issue now.
